data.enText: -ies
a punishment for breaking a law, rule or contract
to impose a penalty

data.chText: 侵犯人身罪可判处最高七年的监禁。
data.enText: Assault carries a maximum penalty of seven years' imprisonment.

data.chText: 无票乘车的罚款为200英镑。
data.enText: The penalty for travelling without a ticket is £200.

data.chText: 承包商如延误工期将被处以巨额罚款。
data.enText: Contractors who fall behind schedule incur heavy financial penalties.
a penalty clause in a contract

data.chText: 您可以随时从账户中提款，不收罚金。
data.enText: You can withdraw money from the account at any time without penalty .
a disadvantage suffered as a result of sth

data.chText: 成名的弊端之一是失掉了隐私。
data.enText: One of the penalties of fame is loss of privacy.
a disadvantage given to a player or a team when they break a rule

data.chText: 他在第一轮受到停赛十秒钟的处罚。
data.enText: He incurred a ten-second penalty in the first round.

before.chText: 足球和其他类似体育运动
before.enText: in football ( soccer ) and some other similar sports

data.enText: a chance to score a goal or point without any defending players, except the goalkeeper , trying to stop it; the goal or point that is given if it is successful. This chance is given because the other team has broken the rules.

data.chText: 两分钟后，福特以一记点球将比分扳平。
data.enText: Two minutes later Ford equalized with a penalty.

data.chText: 对方铲球犯规后，我们得到了一个点球。
data.enText: We were awarded a penalty after a late tackle.
I volunteered to take the penalty (= be the person who tries to score the goal/point) .

data.chText: 在比赛的最后一刻，他罚失了点球。
data.enText: He missed a penalty in the last minute of the game.

simple_means.memory_skill: penal 刑罚的 + ty 表情况 → 惩罚

ex.enText: The penalty for littering is 50 yuan.

ex.chText: 走私者将面临严厉处罚。
请仔细阅读合同中的惩罚条款。
ex.enText: Please read the penalty clauses in the contract carefully.

synonyms.bx: 多指因违反法律、规则或合约而受到的惩罚。

ex.chText: 作为惩罚我昨天被禁止看电视。
ex.enText: I was not allowed to watch TV yesterday as a punishment.

ex.chText: 银行劫匪逃脱不了惩罚。
ex.enText: The bank robbers will not escape punishment.

ex.chText: 法院已经决定给予什么处罚了吗？
ex.enText: Has the Court decided what punishment to impose?

synonyms.bx: 泛指处罚某人的行为和各种手段。

data.enText: pay the penalty (for sth/for doing sth)
pay a/the price (for sth/for doing sth)
to suffer because of bad luck, a mistake or sth you have done

data.chText: 他今天上午脸色很不好，我想这是他一直熬夜造成的。
data.enText: He looked terrible this morning. I think he's paying the penalty for all those late nights.

data.chText: 他们现在正在为过去的错误付出代价。
data.enText: They're now paying the price for past mistakes.

tr: (games) a handicap or disadvantage that is imposed on a competitor (or a team) for an infraction of the rules of the game
the disadvantage or painful consequences of an action or condition
example: neglected his health and paid the penalty

tr: a payment required for not fulfilling a contract

value.def: A penalty is a punishment that someone is given for doing something which is against a law or rule.

example.ex: One of those arrested could face the death penalty...
example.tran: 被捕的那些人中有一人可能被判死刑。

example.ex: The maximum penalty is up to 7 years imprisonment or an unlimited fine.
example.tran: 最高处罚是最多7年监禁或者无上限罚款。

value.def: In sports such as football, rugby, and hockey, a penalty is an opportunity to score a goal, which is given to the attacking team if the defending team breaks a rule near their own goal.

example.ex: Referee Michael Reed had no hesitation in awarding a penalty...
example.tran: 裁判迈克尔·里德毫不犹豫地判了点球。

example.ex: Jonathan Davies scored a penalty goal.
example.tran: 乔纳森·戴维斯点球得分。

value.def: The penalty that you pay for something you have done is something unpleasant that you experience as a result.

example.ex: Why should I pay the penalty for somebody else's mistake?...
It's a penalty of us being girls — sons have an easy time.
example.tran: 这是我们身为女孩的弊端——男孩子们过得轻松。

partsOfSpeech.dec: im 不 + pun 惩罚 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 不受惩罚
pen 惩罚 + al …的 → 刑罚的
penal〔= pen〕惩罚 + ize 使 → 处罚
penal 刑罚的 + ty 表情况 → 惩罚
pen 惩罚 + ance 表状况 → 接受惩罚 → 赎罪
penit〔= pen〕惩罚 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 因受惩罚而后悔 → 后悔的
pun 惩罚 + ish 使… → 惩罚
punish 惩罚 + ment 表结果 → 惩罚
re 反 + pent〔= pen〕惩罚 → 反过来惩罚自己 → 后悔
